title: "Metro" simple condensed sans
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018083556im_/http:/typophile.com/files/metro_6278.gif)

Can anyone ID? It's a simple font, and I've been trying to get one close all day..

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018083556im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mysurfsig_5867.jpg)
author: grafixgirl

comments.content: Linda, I think the geeky-image is grafixgirl’s quote.
Well, it's not terribly obvious as a .sig.... Some of us gave up reading minds for a hobby decades ago. ;-)

I'd say Helvetica-Compressed, but the R is weird.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/compressed/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018083556/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/compressed/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/compressed/")

Or [Helvetica Condensed Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018083556/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/helvetica_condensed_black/&sample_text=METRO&sample_size=96) but I could find nothing that matches the R. A solution with a straight R might be [Griffith Gothic Condensed Ultra](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018083556/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/griffith_gothic_condensed_ultra/&sample_text=METRO&sample_size=144), though it may be too black.

Yup, that geeky is part of my sig. I go by geekygirl in other forums.

Actually, geeky in my sig is Century Gothic my favorite font.

Thanks for the help on the font!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018083556im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mysurfsig_5463.jpg)
